docs.title: API Catalog
docs.description: The WMS Platform exposes APIs through two primary mechanisms: REST APIs (OpenAPI) for synchronous operations and Event APIs (AsyncAPI) for asynchronous, event-driven communication.

docs.title: Events API (AsyncAPI)
docs.description: This document describes the event-driven API using CloudEvents specification.

docs.title: REST API Reference
docs.description: This document provides an overview of the REST APIs exposed by WMS Platform services.

docs.title: AsyncAPI Specifications
docs.description: All WMS Platform event APIs are documented using AsyncAPI 3.0.0. Events follow the CloudEvents 1.0 specification and are published to Apache Kafka.

docs.title: OpenAPI Specifications
docs.description: All WMS Platform REST APIs are documented using OpenAPI 3.0.3. Each service exposes a RESTful API with consistent conventions.

docs.title: C4 Level 4: Code Diagrams
docs.description: Code diagrams show the internal structure of components at the class/struct level, focusing on key domain aggregates and their relationships.

docs.title: C4 Level 3: Component Diagrams
docs.description: Component diagrams show the internal structure of each container, revealing the major building blocks and their interactions.

docs.title: C4 Level 2: Container Diagram
docs.description: The Container diagram shows the high-level technology choices and how responsibilities are distributed across containers (applications, databases, etc.).

docs.title: C4 Level 1: System Context
docs.description: The System Context diagram shows the WMS Platform as a whole and its relationships with external actors and systems.

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.description: The WMS Platform follows a microservices architecture with event-driven communication and workflow orchestration. This document provides a high-level overview of the system design.

docs.title: Order Cancellation Workflow
docs.description: This diagram shows the order cancellation workflow implementing the Saga compensation pattern.

docs.title: Order Fulfillment Workflow
docs.description: This diagram shows the complete end-to-end order fulfillment saga, from order receipt to shipment confirmation using the WES (Warehouse Execution System) as the central execution engine.

docs.title: Packing Workflow
docs.description: This diagram shows the packing child workflow with 7 steps: task creation, material selection, packing, weighing, label generation, label application, and sealing.

docs.title: Picking Workflow
docs.description: This diagram shows the detailed picking child workflow, including task creation, worker assignment, and pick completion signaling.

docs.title: Shipping Workflow (SLAM Process)
docs.description: This diagram shows the shipping child workflow implementing the SLAM process: Scan, Label, Apply, Manifest.

docs.title: Walling Workflow
docs.description: The Walling Workflow handles the put-wall sorting process where walliners (workers) sort picked items from totes into order-specific bins before packing.

docs.title: WES Execution Workflow
docs.description: The WES (Warehouse Execution System) Execution Workflow orchestrates order execution through configurable process paths. It is the central execution engine started by the Orchestrator after wave assignment.

docs.title: Data Flow Diagrams
docs.description: This document describes the data flows within the WMS Platform, including synchronous API calls and asynchronous event flows.

docs.title: Kubernetes Deployment
docs.description: This document describes the Kubernetes deployment architecture for the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Infrastructure Topology
docs.description: This document describes the infrastructure topology of the WMS Platform, including all components and their interactions.

docs.title: ConsolidationUnit Aggregate
docs.description: The ConsolidationUnit aggregate manages the process of combining picked items for multi-item orders.

docs.title: InboundShipment Aggregate
docs.description: The InboundShipment aggregate is the root of the Receiving bounded context, managing the lifecycle of inbound shipments from suppliers.

docs.title: InventoryItem Aggregate
docs.description: The InventoryItem aggregate manages stock levels, locations, and reservations.

docs.title: Order Aggregate
docs.description: The Order aggregate is the root of the Order bounded context, managing the lifecycle of customer orders.

docs.title: PackTask Aggregate
docs.description: The PackTask aggregate manages the packing process for orders.

docs.title: PickRoute Aggregate
docs.description: The PickRoute aggregate manages optimized picking paths through the warehouse.

docs.title: PickTask Aggregate
docs.description: The PickTask aggregate manages warehouse picking operations for orders.

docs.title: PutawayTask Aggregate
docs.description: The PutawayTask aggregate is the root of the Stow bounded context, managing the lifecycle of putaway operations using various storage strategies.

docs.title: Shipment Aggregate
docs.description: The Shipment aggregate manages carrier integration and the SLAM (Scan, Label, Apply, Manifest) process.

docs.title: SortationBatch Aggregate
docs.description: The SortationBatch aggregate is the root of the Sortation bounded context, managing the grouping and sorting of packages by destination for efficient dispatch.

docs.title: Station Aggregate
docs.description: The Station aggregate is the root of the Facility bounded context, managing warehouse stations and their capabilities for process path routing.

docs.title: TaskRoute Aggregate
docs.description: The TaskRoute aggregate is the core domain model in the WES (Warehouse Execution System) bounded context. It tracks order execution through a sequence of stages.

docs.title: WallingTask Aggregate
docs.description: The WallingTask aggregate is the core domain model in the Walling bounded context. It tracks the sorting of picked items from totes into order-specific bins on a put-wall.

docs.title: Wave Aggregate
docs.description: The Wave aggregate manages batches of orders released together for picking.

docs.title: Worker Aggregate
docs.description: The Worker aggregate manages warehouse workforce and task assignments.

docs.title: Bounded Contexts
docs.description: This document describes the bounded contexts within the WMS Platform and their responsibilities.

docs.title: Context Map
docs.description: This document shows the relationships between bounded contexts in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Domain Events
docs.description: This document catalogs all domain events in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Domain-Driven Design Overview
docs.description: The WMS Platform is built following Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles, organizing the system into bounded contexts with rich domain models.

docs.title: Value Objects
docs.description: This document describes the value objects used across the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Apache Kafka
docs.description: Apache Kafka serves as the event streaming platform for the WMS Platform.

docs.title: MongoDB
docs.description: MongoDB is used as the primary database for all WMS Platform services.

docs.title: Observability
docs.description: The WMS Platform uses a comprehensive observability stack for monitoring, logging, and tracing.

docs.title: Infrastructure Overview
docs.description: This document provides an overview of the WMS Platform infrastructure components.

docs.title: Temporal
docs.description: Temporal is the workflow orchestration engine for the WMS Platform.

docs.title: WMS Platform
docs.description: Welcome to the Warehouse Management System (WMS) Platform documentation. This comprehensive guide covers the architecture, design decisions, and implementation details of a production-ready warehouse management system built with microservices.

docs.title: Consolidation Service
docs.description: The Consolidation Service combines picked items for multi-item orders.

docs.title: Facility Service
docs.description: The Facility Service manages warehouse stations, their capabilities, and process path routing.

docs.title: Inventory Service
docs.description: The Inventory Service manages stock levels and warehouse locations.

docs.title: Labor Service
docs.description: The Labor Service manages workforce and task assignments.

docs.title: Orchestrator
docs.description: The Orchestrator is a Temporal worker that executes workflow orchestration for order fulfillment using the WES (Warehouse Execution System) as the central execution engine.

docs.title: Order Service
docs.description: The Order Service manages the complete order lifecycle from receipt to completion.

docs.title: Packing Service
docs.description: The Packing Service handles package preparation and labeling.

docs.title: Picking Service
docs.description: The Picking Service manages warehouse picking operations.

docs.title: Process Path Service
docs.description: The Process Path Service determines the optimal fulfillment process path for orders based on item characteristics and special handling requirements.

docs.title: Receiving Service
docs.description: The Receiving Service manages inbound shipments and the receiving process for goods arriving at the warehouse.

docs.title: Routing Service
docs.description: The Routing Service calculates optimal pick paths through the warehouse.

docs.title: Shipping Service
docs.description: The Shipping Service handles carrier integration and the SLAM process.

docs.title: Sortation Service
docs.description: The Sortation Service manages package sortation, grouping packages by destination and carrier for efficient dispatch.

docs.title: Stow Service
docs.description: The Stow Service manages putaway tasks and storage location assignment using various storage strategies.

docs.title: Walling Service
docs.description: The Walling Service manages put-wall operations for sorting picked items into order-specific bins before packing. It is used in the pickwallpack process path for medium-sized orders.

docs.title: Waving Service
docs.description: The Waving Service groups orders into waves for efficient batch processing.

docs.title: WES Service
docs.description: The Warehouse Execution System (WES) Service orchestrates order execution through configurable process paths, managing the flow from picking through optional walling/consolidation to packing.

docs.title: Consolidation Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing item consolidation from multiple pick totes.

docs.title: Inventory Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing inventory operations including reservations, allocations, and shipments.

docs.title: Order Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing order lifecycle and status transitions.

docs.title: Activities Overview
docs.description: Activities are the building blocks of Temporal workflows, executing the actual business logic.

docs.title: Packing Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing packing tasks, materials, and labels.

docs.title: Picking Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing picking tasks and worker assignments.

docs.title: Process Path Activities
docs.description: Activities for determining and persisting order process paths.

docs.title: Receiving Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing inbound shipment receiving and stow operations.

docs.title: Shipping Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing shipments, carrier manifests, and customer notifications.

docs.title: SLAM Activities
docs.description: Activities for the Scan, Label, Apply, Manifest (SLAM) process.

docs.title: Sortation Activities
docs.description: Activities for managing package sortation to carrier chutes.

docs.title: Unit Activities
docs.description: Activities for unit-level tracking throughout the fulfillment process.

docs.title: Order Flow Diagram
docs.description: Complete visualization of order processing through the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Signal Flow Diagrams
docs.description: Visual representation of signal timing and flow between workflows and external systems.

docs.title: Workflow Hierarchy
docs.description: Visual representation of parent-child workflow relationships in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Temporal Workflow Architecture
docs.description: The WMS Platform uses Temporal as its workflow orchestration engine to coordinate complex, long-running business processes across distributed microservices.

docs.title: Retry Policies
docs.description: Reference for retry configuration and timeout settings in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Signals & Queries
docs.description: Reference for all workflow signals and query handlers in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Task Queues
docs.description: Reference for all Temporal task queues used in the WMS Platform.

docs.title: Cancellation Workflows
docs.description: Workflows for handling order cancellation with proper inventory compensation.

docs.title: ConsolidationWorkflow
docs.description: Coordinates the consolidation of multi-item orders from multiple pick routes or totes.

docs.title: GiftWrapWorkflow
docs.description: Coordinates gift wrap processing for orders that require special packaging and gift messaging.

docs.title: InboundFulfillmentWorkflow
docs.description: Orchestrates the inbound fulfillment process from ASN (Advanced Shipping Notice) through stow.

docs.title: OrderFulfillmentWorkflow
docs.description: The main saga workflow that orchestrates the entire order fulfillment process from validation through shipping.

docs.title: PackingWorkflow
docs.description: Coordinates the packing process for an order including material selection, labeling, and sealing.

docs.title: OrchestratedPickingWorkflow
docs.description: Coordinates the picking process for an order with enhanced features like unit-level tracking and inventory staging.

docs.title: PlanningWorkflow
docs.description: Determines the process path for an order and handles wave assignment with priority-based timeouts.

docs.title: ReprocessingWorkflow
docs.description: Scheduled workflow that automatically reprocesses failed order fulfillment workflows.

docs.title: Consolidation Service - ConsolidationWorkflow
docs.description: Service-level workflow that handles item consolidation with signal-based progress tracking.

docs.title: Packing Service - PackingWorkflow
docs.description: Service-level workflow that handles the packing process with signal-based progress tracking.

docs.title: Picking Service - PickingWorkflow
docs.description: Service-level workflow that handles the picking process with signal-based worker coordination.

docs.title: Shipping Service - ShippingWorkflow
docs.description: Service-level workflow that handles the SLAM (Scan, Label, Apply, Manifest) and shipping process.

docs.title: WES Service - WESExecutionWorkflow
docs.description: Main execution workflow that orchestrates order processing through stages via cross-queue child workflows.

docs.title: ShippingWorkflow
docs.description: Coordinates the SLAM (Scan, Label, Apply, Manifest) and shipping process for completed packages.

docs.title: SortationWorkflow
docs.description: Routes packages to destination chutes based on carrier and destination for final carrier pickup.

docs.title: StockShortageWorkflow
docs.description: Handles compensation for confirmed stock shortages during picking with automatic fulfillment strategy decisions.

docs.title: WESExecutionWorkflow
docs.description: The Warehouse Execution System workflow coordinates picking, walling (consolidation), and packing operations.

items.label: Move order to dead letter queue
